Reason: The 'flush_compression' configuration in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can have a significant impact on system performance. When compression is enabled during the flushing process, it can affect the execution time and memory consumption of the system. Disabling compression may lead to faster flushing but higher memory usage, while enabling compression may reduce memory usage but increase flushing time. Therefore, the value of 'flush_compression' directly influences system performance, making it a performance-sensitive configuration.
